content: velvet scrunchies b y d e e s k n o t z it s safe to say that velvet scrunchies have taken over the crochet community by storm while everyone makes their scrunchies a little differently i believe i ve hacked the key to a perfectly puffed scrunchie here s a very quick pattern to get you started what you ll need stitches used -4 5 mm crochet hook chain - chain -1 ball of bernat velvet in single_crochet - single_crochet your colour of choice double_crochet - double_crochet -pack of elastics slip_stitch - slip_stitch -scissors gauging -darning needle or something to weave in your ends 2 row of 4 double_crochet should measure 1 inch by 1 inch dee s knotz 2020 © tips and pattern info there are lots of different ways to make a velvet scrunchie so use this as a starting place and see how you like the shape and size and feel free to play around with the number of stitches from there i highly recommend handwashing yarn like velvet only when necessary fibers become loose easily and the stitches may worm don t forget to take your scrunchie out of your hair before you shower your scrunchie will take forever to dry i have used various sizes of elastics experiment with what works for you scrunchies using large elastics will fit on your wrist but they are not as uniform or pretty to photograph smaller elastics turn out really nicely but you can t wear it on your wrist when it s not in your hair decide what s better for you when choosing elastics friendly reminder that you have permission to sell products that you create from this pattern but you must give credit as you should with anyone s designs any questions or comments or notes about this pattern can be sent to deannawidmeyer@hotmail com to have your work from this pattern featured tag me in your instagram post or story dee s knotz 2020 © @deesknotz to start row 1 take your yarn and tie a small knot to attach your yarn to the elastic pull up a loop by placing your crochet hook inside the elastic and pulling up yarn then chain 1 work 30 single_crochet around your elastic join your last stitch to the first stitch not the knot you tied to secure your yarn with a slip_stitch row 2 chain 3 2 more double_crochet in the same stitch double_crochet 3 in next stitch double_crochet 4 in next stitch for the rest of the stitches repeat * 3dc 3dc 4dc* until the end of the row join your last stitch to your first stitch with a slip_stitch and fasten_off weave in ends dee s knotz 2020 © pro tip be very mindful and precise when weaving in your ends if you choose to weave in the ends closer to the elastic there is potential for the end to pop back out of where you weaved it i like to weave
